intro: Reseda germanicopolitana subsp. glabra, commonly known as the smooth reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
